template: Generate one single-sentence plain-English prompt describing a multi-case customer support automation workflow for a {business_type} that involves triage, automatic resolution of simple issues, escalation of complex cases, and performance tracking; output only the prompt text under 40 words.
filled_prompt: Generate one single-sentence plain-English prompt describing a multi-case customer support automation workflow for a managed hosting provider that involves triage, automatic resolution of simple issues, escalation of complex cases, and performance tracking; output only the prompt text under 40 words.

message.content: Create a customer support automation system for a managed hosting provider that performs triage, auto-resolves simple issues, escalates complex cases, and includes performance tracking.
message.reasoning_content:
First, the user wants a single-sentence prompt in plain English. It should describe a multi-case customer support automation workflow for a managed hosting provider. The workflow includes triage, automatic resolution of simple issues, escalation of complex cases, and performance tracking.

Key elements to include:
- Triage: Sorting or categorizing issues.
- Automatic resolution: Solving simple issues automatically.
- Escalation: Sending complex cases to human agents or higher levels.
- Performance tracking: Monitoring and measuring how well the workflow is performing.

The prompt must be under 40 words. I need to ensure it's concise and covers all these points in one sentence.

Structure the sentence: Start with the purpose or context, then list the components. For example: "Design a customer support automation workflow that handles triage, auto-resolves simple issues, escalates complex cases, and tracks performance."

Check the word count: "Design a customer support automation workflow that handles triage, auto-resolves simple issues, escalates complex cases, and tracks performance." â€“ Let's count: Design (1), a (2), customer (3), support (4), automation (5), workflow (6), that (7), handles (8), triage (9), auto-resolves (10), simple (11), issues (12), escalates (13), complex (14), cases (15), and (16), tracks (17), performance (18). That's 18 words. Under 40, so good.

But I need to specify it's for a managed hosting provider. So, incorporate that: "For a managed hosting provider, design a support automation workflow that triages issues, auto-resolves simple ones, escalates complex cases, and tracks performance."

Word count: For (1), a (2), managed (3), hosting (4), provider (5), design (6), a (7), support (8), automation (9), workflow (10), that (11), triages (12), issues (13), auto-resolves (14), simple (15), ones (16), escalates (17), complex (18), cases (19), and (20), tracks (21), performance (22). 22 words. Still under 40.

Make it more natural: "Create a customer support automation system for a managed hosting provider that performs triage, automatically resolves simple issues, escalates complex cases, and includes performance tracking."

Word count: Create (1), a (2), customer (3), support (4), automation (5), system (6), for (7), a (8), managed (9), hosting (10), provider (11), that (12), performs (13), triage (14), automatically (15), resolves (16), simple (17), issues (18), escalates (19), complex (20), cases (21), and (22), includes (23), performance (24), tracking (25). 25 words.

This seems clear and covers all points. I'll go with this version.

Final check: Is it a single sentence? Yes. Plain English? Yes. Under 40 words? Yes.
